div.p: Pupil of Heinrich Schenker's in the 1890s and 1900s.

Klobassa is first referred to in Schenker's diary on September 12, 1897 as "my pupil," where he is mysteriously likened to Hamlet. Whether or not he continued taking lessons in the intervening period is unknown, but he certain did so in 1906/07. In December 1906 he was late in paying his fees, and again in June 1907 his end-of-year fees, such that Schenker had to threaten legal action (diary, May 1907) in order to force him to pay up. Klobassa failed to attend at the beginning of the teaching year 1907/08 (diary, October 1, 1907). No references to him appear to exist in Schenker's diaries after those dates. Nothing else is known of him.
